title: The Minimax Theorem: Playing Not to Lose
description: A quick, practical guide to The Minimax Theorem: Playing Not to Lose.

hook.text: Von Neumann proved that in any two-player zero-sum game, there's a strategy that minimizes your maximum possible loss.

buildup.text: Minimax: assume your opponent is perfect. Choose the move that gives the best outcome against their best response.

discovery.text: In chess, minimax is exactly how engines think.

climax.text: Minimax teaches a profound strategic lesson.

punchline.text: Great strategists don't play to win. They play to not lose.
